title: megadose - Wiktionary, the free dictionary
cleaned_text: [dose](/wiki/dose)of drug or vitamin far exceeding the normal or recommended amount, and usually given intentionally. Compare [overdose](/wiki/overdose). - 1987, Kerry Cue, Hang On To Your Horses Doovers, page 91: - [F]rom biblical times [...] to modern times when men are served megadoses of vitamin E for breakfast, women too have been interested in the potency of popular potions. Verb[ and past participle [megadosed](/wiki/megadosed#English)) - ( [transitive](/wiki/Appendix:Glossary#transitive)) To dose (a patient) with a very large amount of a drug. - ( [transitive](/wiki/Appendix:Glossary#transitive)) To dose with a very large amount of (a drug).
